com.ino.freehost.client

Class RW3270Field

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ino.freehost.client.RW3270Field

  • public class RW3270Field
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a Tn3270 'Field' object. You can obtain an enumeration of RW3270Field objects by calling RW3270.getFields(). You can also get the 'current' field. (The field that the current cursor position is located in) by calling RW3270.getField(). Finally, you can get the RW3270Field object at any given cursor position by calling RW3270.getField(int cursorPosition).

    This class is useful for working with 3270 fields. For example, if you wanted to enter data from a GUI textField:

    • Constructor Detail

      • RW3270Field

        protected RW3270Field(RW3270Char fa,
                      RW3270 rw)
        Not seen by end-programmers. The data stream handles the creation and destruction of field objects

    • Method Detail

      • isProtected

        public boolean isProtected()
        Checks the field to see if the current field is an 'input' field (unprotected)
        Returns:
        true - if the field is protected, false if it isn't.

      • isProtected

        protected void isProtected(boolean b)

      • setBegin

        protected void setBegin(int i)

      • getBegin

        public int getBegin()
        Returns:
        The data buffer address of the FA (first character) in this field

      • setEnd

        protected void setEnd(int i)
        Sets the data buffer address of the last character in this field (Not visible to end-programmers... handled by the data stream)

      • getEnd

        public int getEnd()
        Returns:
        The data buffer address of the last character in this field

      • isModified

        public boolean isModified()
        Returns:
        True if this field has been modified by the operator

      • isModified

        public void isModified(boolean b)
                throws IsProtectedException
        Sets the MDT for this field. If you change the data via the setData() method this method is called for you automatically. Otherwise, be sure to call this method whenever you change the data in an unprotected (input) field.
        Parameters:
        b - True if the field has been modified.
        Throws:
        IsProtectedException

      • getChars

        public RW3270Char[] getChars()
        Gets an array of RW3270Char objects representing the contents of this field This method is only useful if you need to operate on the individual RW3270Char objects. For display of data buffer (screen), use getDisplayChars() instead.
        Returns:
        array of RW3270Char objects.
        See Also:
        RW3270Char

      • getDisplayChars

        public char[] getDisplayChars()
        Gets an array of characters containing the display representation of this field. Specifically, hidden and null characters are represented by an ' '
        Returns:
        char[] - array of characters

      • setData

        public void setData(java.lang.String s)
             throws java.io.IOException,
                    IsProtectedException
        If the field is an input field (unprotected), this method will set the field to the specified String. If the string is longer than the field, this method will throw an IOException.
        Parameters:
        s - The string to insert into this field
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - - thrown if the string is longer than the field
        IsProtectedException - - thrown if the current field is protected

      • size

        public int size()
        This method returns the size, in characters of the current field. Be aware that this includes the Field Attribute for the field, as well as the characters
        Returns:
        The size (in characters) of this Field object

      • getForegroundColor

        public int getForegroundColor()
        Returns:
        The foreground (text) color of this field. (Corresponding to the color constants defined in the RW3270Char class)

      • getBackgroundColor

        public int getBackgroundColor()
        Returns:
        The background color of this field. (Corresponding to the color constants defined in the RW3270Char class)

      • getHighlighting

        public int getHighlighting()
        Returns:
        The highlighting scheme for this field. (Corresponding to the highlighting constants defined in the RW3270Char class)

      • isHidden

        public boolean isHidden()
        Returns:
        True if the field is hidden (i.e. password field), False if it is not.

      • isBold

        public boolean isBold()
        Returns:
        True if the field is bold, False if it is not.

      • isNumeric

        public boolean isNumeric()
        Returns:
        True if the field only accepts numeric data, False if it will accept any alphanumeric input. Client implementations should test input if this method returns true and reject it if it is not numeric/

      • getFieldAttribute

        public int getFieldAttribute()
